trial_identification.studytitle: Tedizolid Phosphate (TR-701 FA) vs Linezolid for the Treatment of Nosocomial Pneumonia (MK-1986-002)
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A Phase 3 Randomized Double-blind Study Comparing TR-701 FA and Linezolid in Ventilated Gram-positive Nosocomial Pneumonia

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Studies of infection and infectious agents

interventions.interventions:
Treatment: drugs - Tedizolid phosphate IV Treatment: drugs - Linezolid
Experimental: Tedizolid phosphate IV - Tedizolid phosphate 200 mg IV once daily for 7 days, or 14 days for bacteremia
Active Comparator: Linezolid IV - Linezolid 600 mg IV every 12 hours for 10 days, or 14 days for bacteremia
Treatment: drugs: Tedizolid phosphate IV Tedizolid phosphate IV 200 mg once daily
Treatment: drugs: Linezolid Linezolid IV 600 mg twice daily

primaryOutcome.outcome: All Cause Mortality - ACM within 28 days after randomization (ITT Analysis Set)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: All Cause Mortality, Micro-ITT - ACM within 28 days after randomization (Micro-ITT Analysis Set)
Clinical Response - Clinical response at Test of Cure (TOC)
All Cause Mortality, MSSA/MRSA - ACM in participants with methicillin-susceptible Staphylococcus aureus (MSSA) or methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) (Micro-ITT Analysis Set)
Clinical Response, MSSA/MRSA - Clinical response by Investigator in participants with MSSA or MRSA (Micro-ITT and ME-2 Analysis Sets)
Microbiological response - Microbiological response at EOT and TOC (Micro-ITT, ME-1, and ME-2 Analysis Sets)

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
- Requires IV antibiotic therapy with diagnosis of ventilated nosocomial pneumonia
- Gram-positive bacteria on respiratory Gram stain
eligibility.exclusivecriteria:
- Pneumonia of viral, fungal or parasitic etiology
- Structural lung abnormalities
- Immunosuppression
- Previous antibiotics for > 24 hours
- Expected survival of < 72 hours

ethicsAndSummary.summary:
This is a 1:1 ratio, randomized, double-blind, double-dummy, multicenter, global Phase 3 study of tedizolid phosphate (TR-701 FA) 200 mg intravenous (IV) once daily for 7 days versus linezolid (Zyvox®, Zyvoxid®, etc) 600 mg IV every 12 hours for 10 days for the treatment of ventilated participants with presumed gram-positive hospital-acquired bacterial pneumonia (HABP) or ventilator-associated bacterial pneumonia (VABP). Participants with concurrent gram-positive bacteremia are to receive 14 days of active therapy in either treatment arm.
Approximately 300 sites will participate. Ventilated participants with HABP/VABP caused by presumed gram-positive pathogen(s) at baseline, as determined by positive Gram stain, will be randomized 1:1 to study drug treatment.
